reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The best part of this hotel was that there was plenty of parking and the rooms were clean. If that is all you are looking for...this is your place. However, there were too many negatives. It's a good 15 minute walk to Mittenwald and if it is raining (as it was for us), it might as well have been 30 miles. The lady operating the hotel seemed terribly annoyed and inconvenienced by our family and did everything possible to make us feel uncomfortable. This owner should not be in the hospitality business.
reviews.title: Don't Bother...Find a Hotel Closer to Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: She nearly screamed at us for showing up 5 minutes early for breakfast...although we were content to just wait at our table until the 8am start. If you like hot coffee with your breakfast...you are out of luck here. For some peculiar reason, coffee was always delivered after our family had finished eating our food from the breakfast buffet. Requests for coffee with breakfast was met by contempt. If you don't show up at 8am (which we decided on our 2nd morning might not be a good idea...so we cruised in at 8:20am), you are screwed by a run on the food and slim pickins. We got aced out by a run on the muffins and bread and the lady/owner simply replied 'No More'. I know these complaints might seem petty, but when you are traveling as a family of 5 and required to rent 2 rooms to accomodate the kids and you represent 30% of the occupancy, you would hope for a little respect. We did not get this. Questions regarding hot in-room refrigerator, bathroom usage (we had to share one bathroom), directions to town were met with hostility. After 2 days, we wanted to pay the bill and get out of town quickly. Surprise, they don't take credit cards (or so they said). They only take cash. Well it sure would have been nice to have known this a head of time as we didn't have enough cash on us. The lady/owner's response...hike to town and withdraw it from a bank. It truly was unbelievable. We spent 25 days in Europe and this was by FAR the least hospitable hotel (actually, we loved all our other hotels) we encountered. You have been warned.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay in Mittenwald

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My two children (aged 9 and 11) and I stayed at this family¨friendly hotel for 3 nights. We had a triple room with a balcony on the second floor. The room was very clean, comfortable and quiet. The daily breakfast was plentiful and delicious. My children enjoyed romping in the grassy play area and resident dog and cat. The owner was quite helpful to us when we asked her for directions and advice. She advised us that we could rent bicycles at a store in the train station and we had a great time bicycling the area one sunny afternoon. She also told us where we could find a luge ride in nearby Garmisch. This hotel is a short walk (no more than 10 minutes) to the center of Mittenwald where there are many restaurants and shops. We would definitely stay here again in the future.
reviews.title: OK, but somewhat disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Garni for three nights in May. We traveled for three weeks staying at 7 different types of hotels and B and B's (mainly in Germany, 3 nights in Austria). We paid as low as $70 and as high as $200 a night in 2 and 3 star places. This was our least favorite place.
reviews.title: Stay here if you are looking for a warm welcome and cosy rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While we agree with most of what other writers have mentioned, we were disappointed with:
reviews.title: do NOT MISS this one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for four nights in June and had a wonderful time. We were greeted and shown to our room by Angelica, who gave us some suggestions for dinner that evening. The town center is an easy walk from the hotel, or there are several parking areas available.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Mittenwald.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is in a fine location with great views. The room was very clean and spacious and the bed was comfortable. We had one of the suites, so there was a small refrigerator and kitchenette. Breakfast was very good, consisting of meats and cheese, eggs, fruits, cereals, breads and jams. Several juices and coffee or tea are available.
reviews.title: The perfect Bed and Breakfast Inn in Bavaria

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Several reviews have pointed out that the hotel only accepts cash for payment. This is true, so come prepared. Also, many of the restaurants and some of the shops in town do not take credit cards. If you are driving, this also applies to the gas stations in the area. There are a few banks in town with ATM's, so you can get cash if you need some.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay. No CC accepted and could not give change.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the price you pay and the service you get, this hotel is a very good value. Add in the beauty of the area and it's a great place to spend time in Bavaria.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our three night stay was perfect. When we drove up to the inn, the owner was getting ready to plant her spring flowers, She greeted us like friends, and took us to our wonderful suite. WOW! It was the best bedroom we stayed in our entire three week stay in Europe.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: This B&B was all that we hoped it wuld be and more. The Edlhuner family made us feel welcomed from the moment we checked in to our departure. We enjoyed breakfast conversations with fellow guest and friendly chats with the staff (though a little challenging with my broken German.)
reviews.title: This B&B puts Mittenwald at the top of your Bavarian to do list

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the family ajoining rooms at the helpful suggestion of the owner. The rooms were clean and cozy and we especially enjoyed the cold mountain breezes coming through the casement windows. The view of the mountains from the deck was stunning. There was internet access in the dining area, but not in our rooms. That turned out to be no big deal since we were out enjoying the area the majority of the time. The guesthouse is within walking distance of "downtown" Mittenwald, and mere steps from a trailhead leading to beautiful gorge overlook.
reviews.title: Mittenwald is charming, and so is Hotel Edlhuber

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009
reviews.text: Being avid hikers, our best time was exploring the trails along the Leutaschklamm Gorge. There wasn't much to complain about during our trip, but I guess the most disappointing thing was that the weather prohibited us from taking the tram t the top of the mountain (but you can't blame the Edlhuner family for this!)
reviews.title: Great staff, great stay in Mittenwald

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were thrilled that we decided to spend the night in the incredibly cozy and charming village of Mittenwald, and equally happy that we spent it with the Edlhubers. This is a very traditional family guesthouse with lovely rooms and a very fine breakfast spread. We found the hostess, Angelica, to be sweet, chatty, and helpful. Would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Perfect Setting, Perfect Hostess

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a very good hotel stay here. We were greeted very warmly by the hotel owner. The rooms were very nice, clean and roomy with good view of the mountain. The owner went out of her way to make sure we had what we needed. The breakfasts in the morning were VERY GOOD and the staff were very helpfull. The hotel is situated just minutes from downtown. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area.
reviews.title: Wonderful place in a beautiful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We LOVED Mittenwald, and we loved this hotel. We didn't encounter any rudeness at all from anybody. In fact, the hostess/owner went out of her way to be helpful. She provided maps, directions, and suggestions for hikes/walks; and was very responsive and eager to please at breakfasts, serving plates of meats and cheeses to each individual table and piping hot coffee or tea as requested. There is also a supply of mineral water, beer, and other drinks for guests -- you keep track of what you drink and pay at the end -- the prices are very reasonable. The hotel is in a fantastic location, with hikes/walks starting pretty much right out the front door. Our room was clean and spacious with a wonderful view. You can hear the wonderful Isar River at night, as you are falling asleep -- very nice. The gorge that everyone talks about is just across the street (if you go all way to the end of gorge and turn left at the street, there is a nice restaurant/guesthouse down a bit on the left side); and the Karwendel cable car is just a 10-15 min walk. My only complaint, and it's not even really a complaint since it didn't keep me from enjoying myself, would be that my mattress had an uncomfortable soft spot in the middle and I had to sort of sleep over to one side.
reviews.title: lovely stay in Mittenwald

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the owner to be very friendly and welcoming and was expecting us. She showed us to our room and even carried our large suitcase. When we got to our room there were chocolates on our bed which was a nice touch. The bed was the best bed I slept on during our 10 day trip of Germany and Austria. We had a suite which was very large with separate living/dining area, kitchen, bedroom and bathroom. There was a hot plate to cook on but no pots/pans. The fridge was nice to have and the kettle so we could make tea. The balcony was very nice with beautiful views of the mountains and a stream. The bathroom looked like it had just been refurbished and had nice amenities including a hair dryer. It was spotlessly clean. Breakfast was very nice and personalized service. One day we had to leave early to go to Neuschwanstein and they arranged to have breakfast ready at 7:30 instead of the usual 8:00. I arranged this in advance through e-mail. It is not far from town at all, maybe a 7 min. walk. I would recommend doing the gorge walk, just take the path directly across the street. Mittenwald was beautiful and hope to return and would not hestiate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay in beautiful Mittenwald

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were going to Mittenwald (for a 3 night stay) via a 5 hour train ride from further north in Germany, with 5 transfers. At one of the towns, there was a train track change, however, if it was mentioned over the train's sound system, it was not done in English, so we were unaware of the change. By the way, this was the only train glitch during our 2 weeks using German trains. Needless to say, we missed the train and had to wait an hour for the next one. This meant that we were going to be at least 1 hour later than we told the owner we'd be. The train station is about 15 minutes from the Edlhuber and we took a couple of wrong turns while walking there, making our arrival an additional 1/2 hour late. Thank goodness a local man helped us by walking us there. We had no phone.
reviews.title: We were not treated very well here and would not stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Upon our arrival at the Edlhuber, the owner's first words to us were "You're late!" Not much of a welcome and I'd say it was pretty much all downhill after that. Upon returning home and reading a couple of the July 2009 reviews, I wondered why we'd had such a different experience than they did. I was relieved to see the July 11th review. It wasn't just us, and that reviewer's experience was similar to ours.
reviews.title: It's worth going to Mittenwald just to stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were not given the adjoining family room that we had discussed in e-mails and when trying to let the owner know the reason we wanted a different room (the one we were supposed to have), we were met with the old "language communication problem." She changed us to a more appropriate room for the 2nd and 3rd nights (less expensive as well), but she wasn't happy about it. We were charged the first room rate for the 3 nights anyway, with additional fees as well. We were aware of the cash only policy.
reviews.title: This may be one of the best family-run establishments in Mittenwald
